content:
The President pro tempore called the Senate to order at 1030 a.m., the Chaplain offered a prayer, and the President pro tempore led the Senate in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag of the United States of America.
The Journal
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date. 
Certain Procedures Dispensed With
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
Transaction of Morning Business
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today .
Legislative Business (Friday, July 30)
 H.R. 3684
 (Rep. DeFazio)
        A bill to authorize funds for Federal-aid highways , highway safety programs, and transit programs, and for other purposes .
        -- Motion to proceed to measure considered in Senate.
        -- Motion to proceed to consideration of measure agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 66 - 28. Record Vote Number 
        -- Measure laid before Senate by motion.
 S. 1046
 (Sen. Cornyn)
        A bill to amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to reauthorize the residential substance use disorder treatment program, and for other purposes.
        -- Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.
        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
 S. 1301
 (Sen. Brown)
        A bill to provide for the publication by the Secretary of Health and Human Services of physical activity recommendations for Americans.
        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
 S. 2045
 (Sen. Cruz)
        A bill to designate the area between the intersections of 16th Street, Northwest and Fuller Street, Northwest and 16th Street, Northwest and Euclid Street, Northwest in Washington, District of Columbia, as "Oswaldo Paya Way".
        -- Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.
        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
 S.Res. 318
 (Sen. Feinstein)
        A resolution expressing support for the designation of July 2021 as "American Grown Flower and Foliage Month" .
        -- Senate Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry discharged by Unanimous Consent.
        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
 S.Res. 333
 (Sen. Stabenow)
        A resolution relating to the death of the Honorable Carl Levin, former Senator for the State of Michigan .
        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
Executive Business (Friday, July 30)
 PN247
        Janie Simms Hipp, of Arkansas, to be General Counsel of the Department of Agriculture
        -- Considered by Senate.
        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.
 PN360
        Susanna V. Blume, of the District of Columbia, to be Director of Cost Assessment and Program Evaluation, Department of Defense
        -- Considered by Senate.
        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.
 PN369
        Ur Mendoza Jaddou, of California, to be Director of the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services, Department of Homeland Security
        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 41. Record Vote Number 
        -- Considered by Senate.
        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 34. Record Vote Number 
 PN434
        Margaret Vo Schaus, of Virginia, to be Chief Financial Officer, National Aeronautics and Space Administration
        -- Considered by Senate.
        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.
Adjournment
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schumer, at  712 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 11 a.m. tomorrow.

Mr. Ben Ray Lujan, from the State of New Mexico, called the Senate to order at 1030 a.m., the Chaplain offered a prayer, and Mr. Lujan led the Senate in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag of the United States of America.
The Journal
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date. 
Certain Procedures Dispensed With
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
Transaction of Morning Business
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.
Legislative Business (Wednesday, August  4)
 H.R. 3684
 (Rep. DeFazio)
        A bill to authorize funds for Federal-aid highways , highway safety programs, and transit programs, and for other purposes.
        -- Considered by Senate.
 S.Amdt. 2131
 (Sen. Carper)
        To strike a definition.
        --Amendment pending in Senate. 
 S.Amdt. 2137
 (Sen. Sinema)
        In the nature of a substitute.
        --Amendment pending in Senate. 
 S.Amdt. 2146
 (Sen. Wicker)
        To provide that the Administrative Procedures Act shall apply to actions taken by the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information in carrying out the Broadband Equity, Access , and Deployment Program.
        --Amendment SA 2146 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Wicker to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2146 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 43 - 55. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2164
 (Sen. Fischer)
        To promote transparency by requiring the establishment of an online interactive map displaying the locations of broadband deployment projects that are funded by the Federal Government.
        --Amendment SA 2164 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Fischer to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2164 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 95 - 0. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2210
 (Sen. Kennedy)
        To provide emergency assistance for disaster response and recovery, and for other expenses, directly related to Hurricanes Laura, Delta, and Zeta.
        --Amendment SA 2210 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Kennedy to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2210, under the order of 8/4/2021, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 19 - 79. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2233
 (Sen. Lankford)
        To prohibit Federal funding for any entity that fails to enroll in and comply with the E-Verify Program.
        --Amendment SA 2233 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Lankford to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2233, under the order of 8/4/2021, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 45. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2245
 (Sen. Johnson)
        To prohibit the cancellation of contracts for physical barriers and other border security measures for which funds already have been obligated and for which penalties will be incurred in the case of such cancellation and prohibiting the use of funds for payment of such penalties.
        --Amendment pending in Senate. 
        --Amendment SA 2245, under the order of 8/3/2021, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 48 - 49. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2279
 (Sen. Lee)
        To establish a project delivery program under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 for water storage infrastructure projects.
        --Amendment SA 2279 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Lee to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2279, under the order of 8/4/2021, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 50. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2338
 (Sen. Scott, of FL)
        To prohibit funds from being disbursed or obligated if the Congressional Budget Office determines that such disbursement or obligation would result in an increase in inflation.
        --Amendment SA 2338 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Scott FL to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2338, under the order of 8/4/2021, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 42 - 55. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2358
 (Sen. Rosen)
        To modify a provision relating to providing support for activities to increase the resiliency of the National Highway System to mitigate the cost of damages from wildfires.
        --Amendment SA 2358 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Rosen to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2358 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote. 
 S.Amdt. 2449
 (Sen. Daines)
        To provide additional funds for post-fire restoration activities and restoration activities carried out using good neighbor agreements.
        --Amendment SA 2449 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Daines to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2449, under the order of 8/4/2021, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 48 - 50. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2464
 (Sen. Peters)
        To modify certain provisions relating to cybersecurity.
        --Amendment SA 2464 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Peters to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2464, under the order of 8/4/2021, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 96 - 2. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2478
 (Sen. Cardin)
        To require the Minority Business Development Agency of the Department of Commerce to promote and administer programs in the public and private sectors to assist the development of minority business enterprises and to ensure that such Agency has the necessary supporting resources, particularly during economic downturns.
        --Amendment SA 2478 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Cardin to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2478 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote. 
 S.Amdt. 2548
 (Sen. Bennet)
        To require the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a Joint Chiefs Landscape Restoration Partnership program.
        --Amendment SA 2548 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Bennet to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2548 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote. 
 S.Amdt. 2564
 (Sen. Carper)
        To improve provisions relating to appropriations for the Corps of Engineers.
        --Amendment SA 2564 proposed by Senator Carper to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2564 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote. 
 S.Amdt. 2570
 (Sen. Schumer)
        To establish safety standards for certain limousines.
        --Amendment SA 2570 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2570 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 58 - 39. Record Vote Number 
Adjournment
Under the authority of the order of today, at  936 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Mr. Warnock in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 1030 a.m. tomorrow.

Mr. Martin Heinrich, from the State of New Mexico, called the Senate to order at 11 a.m., the Chaplain offered a prayer, and Mr. Heinrich led the Senate in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag of the United States of America.
The Journal
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date. 
Certain Procedures Dispensed With
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
Transaction of Morning Business
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today .
Adjournment
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schumer, at  953 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 12 noon tomorrow.

Mr. Raphael G. Warnock, from the State of Georgia, called the Senate to order at 1030 a.m., the Chaplain offered a prayer, and Mr. Warnock led the Senate in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag of the United States of America.
The Journal
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date. 
Certain Procedures Dispensed With
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
Transaction of Morning Business
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.
Legislative Business (Tuesday, August  3)
 H.R. 3325
 (Rep. Pelosi)
        A bill to award four congressional gold medals to the United States Capitol Police and those who protected the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021.
        -- Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.
        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
        -- Message on Senate action sent to the House.
 H.R. 3684
 (Rep. DeFazio)
        A bill to authorize funds for Federal-aid highways , highway safety programs, and transit programs, and for other purposes.
        -- Considered by Senate.
 S.Amdt. 2131
 (Sen. Carper)
        To strike a definition.
        --Amendment pending in Senate. 
 S.Amdt. 2137
 (Sen. Sinema)
        In the nature of a substitute.
        --Amendment pending in Senate. 
 S.Amdt. 2140
 (Sen. Duckworth)
        To require recipients of all stations accessibility grants to adopt plans to pursue public transportation accessibility projects that provide accessibility for individuals with disabilities.
        --Amendment SA 2140 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Duckworth to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2140, under the order of 8/3/2021, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 48 - 50. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2181
 (Sen. Lummis)
        To require the Secretary of Transportation to carry out a highway cost allocation study.
        --Amendment pending in Senate. 
        --Amendment SA 2181, under the order of 8/2/2021, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 95 - 3. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2245
 (Sen. Johnson)
        To prohibit the cancellation of contracts for physical barriers and other border security measures for which funds already have been obligated and for which penalties will be incurred in the case of such cancellation and prohibiting the use of funds for payment of such penalties.
        --Amendment SA 2245 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Johnson to Amendment SA 2137. 
 S.Amdt. 2255
 (Sen. Lee)
        In the nature of a substitute.
        --Amendment SA 2255 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Lee to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2255, under the order of 8/3/2021, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 20 - 78. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2300
 (Sen. Cruz)
        To designate additional high priority corridors on the National Highway system.
        --Amendment SA 2300 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Cruz to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2300 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote. 
 S.Amdt. 2354
 (Sen. Van Hollen)
        To include a payment and performance security requirement for certain infrastructure funding.
        --Amendment SA 2354 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Van Hollen to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2354, under the order of 8/3/2021, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 97 - 0. Record Vote Number 
 S.Res. 310
 (Sen. Menendez)
        A resolution expressing solidarity with Cuban citizens demonstrating peacefully for fundamental freedoms, condemning the Cuban regime's acts of repression, and calling for the immediate release of arbitrarily detained Cuban citizens.
        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate with an amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
 S.Res. 335
 (Sen. King)
        A resolution designating September 25, 2021, as "National Lobster Day".
        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
Executive Business (Tuesday, August  3)
 PN458
        Stacey A. Dixon, of the District of Columbia, to be Principal Deputy Director of National Intelligence
        -- Considered by Senate.
        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.
 PN569
        Eunice C. Lee, of New York, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Second Circuit
        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.
        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.
Adjournment
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schumer, at  823 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 1030 a.m. tomorrow.

The President pro tempore called the Senate to order at 12 noon, the Chaplain offered a prayer, and the President pro tempore led the Senate in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag of the United States of America.
The Journal
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date. 
Certain Procedures Dispensed With
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
Transaction of Morning Business
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.
Legislative Business (Monday, August  2)
 H.R. 3684
 (Rep. DeFazio)
        A bill to authorize funds for Federal-aid highways , highway safety programs, and transit programs, and for other purposes.
        -- Considered by Senate.
 S.Amdt. 2131
 (Sen. Carper)
        To strike a definition.
        --Amendment SA 2131 proposed by Senator Carper to Amendment SA 2137. 
 S.Amdt. 2133
 (Sen. Padilla)
        To amend the Indian Health Care Improvement Act to expand the funding authority for renovating, constructing, and expanding certain facilities.
        --Amendment SA 2133 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Padilla to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2133, under the order of 8/2/2021, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 90 - 7. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2137
 (Sen. Sinema)
        In the nature of a substitute.
        --Amendment pending in Senate. 
 S.Amdt. 2162
 (Sen. Thune)
        To address the workforce needs of the telecommunications industry.
        --Amendment SA 2162 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Thune to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2162, under the order of 8/2/2021, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 95 - 1. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2180
 (Sen. Barrasso)
        To limit the use of certain funds made available for grants to enable the sustained cost-effective implementation of updated building energy codes.
        --Amendment SA 2180 proposed by Senator Carper for Senator Barrasso to Amendment SA 2137. 
        --Amendment SA 2180, under the order of 8/2/2021, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 45 - 48. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2181
 (Sen. Lummis)
        To require the Secretary of Transportation to carry out a highway cost allocation study.
        --Amendment SA 2181 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Lummis to Amendment SA 2137. 
Adjournment
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schumer, at  900 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 1030 a.m. tomorrow.

The President pro tempore called the Senate to order at 12 noon, the Chaplain offered a prayer, and the President pro tempore led the Senate in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag of the United States of America.
The Journal
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date. 
Certain Procedures Dispensed With
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
Transaction of Morning Business
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.
Legislative Business (Sunday, August  1)
 H.R. 3684
 (Rep. DeFazio)
        A bill to authorize funds for Federal-aid highways , highway safety programs, and transit programs, and for other purposes.
        -- Considered by Senate.
 S.Amdt. 2137
 (Sen. Sinema)
        In the nature of a substitute.
        --Amendment SA 2137 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Sinema. 
Adjournment
Under the authority of the order of today, at 1027 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Mr. Padilla in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 12 noon tomorrow.
